metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19746 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
make_arrow in arrow.c in Xfig fig2dev 3.2.7b allows a segmentation fault and out-of-bounds write because of an integer overflow via a large arrow type.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fig2dev - 1:3.2.7b-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fig2dev package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.2.7b-3ubuntu1').
